1580487512_1Fi8DX6DCYM65akSho5nuAZRmKxn9.body: Yes, But some of them do not appear as a so-called backdoor. For example, Intel had developed a debug bridge over USB 3.0(used on some of the Xeon processers). So in some occasion, if you had set something wrong in UEFI, thus a simply plug of a USB device could easily read every instruction and every byte in your internal memory. However, this technology is so convinient and widely-used so that we mostly do not recognize it as a serious safety leak.
Also, I guess the reason why China has banned the import of TPM chipset is that the gov is afraid of having a backdoor in such a highly-secured chipset.
